Another route that meets accessible route requirements would then be recommended.

properties.solution: The handrails shall have a diameter of 1 1/4" to 2" for a circular handrail and for non-circular shall have a diameter of 2 1/4" and a perimeter dimension of 4" minimum to 6 1/4" maximum.

properties.solution: Relocate the dryer or the baby changing table to provide a clear accessible route that is 36 inches wide but can narrow down to 32 inches but for no more that 24 inches.

properties.barrier: The women's restroom door has a threshold too high at 3/4 inch.
properties.solution: Provide a threshold at the doorway that is no more than 1/2 inches high and beveled at a 1:2 slope.

properties.barrier: The ramps inside the Primate Exhibit building needs handrails on both sides for 19 feet.
properties.solution: Provide handrails with extensions on both sides of the ramp for a total of 38 feet. Mount the handrails to 34 inches to 38 inches to the top of the gripping surface.

properties.barrier: The set of ramps on the north side of the exhibits has slopes too steep.  Upper ramp slope is 8.8% for 10 feet. Lower ramp slope is 8.9% for 10 feet.
properties.solution: Remove and regrade section to provide an accessible route with a running slope no greater than 5% and an cross slope no greater than 2%. Option: Since this area is equal to a ramp slope construction tolerances, adding only handrails on both sides would be acceptable. See ADAAG 405.8.

properties.barrier: The north theater viewing area and multilevel seating does not provide handrails at stairs.
properties.solution: Provide handrails on both sides of the stairs that are, continuous on the inside, between 34 inches to 38 inches to the top of the railing above the stair nosing, have an outside diameter of between 1 1/4 inches to 2 inches, have handrails extensions, provide clear space of 1 1/2 inches and comply with ADAAG 505. Theater seating can have breaks in the handrail on the seat side.

properties.barrier: The stanching straps are mounted too high and not cane detectable.
properties.solution: Provide a second staunched strap or of different design so a cane can detect a strap below 27 inches.

properties.barrier: The Tram Stop curb ramp has an abrupt transition of 3/4 inch.
properties.solution: Grind down or replace section of sidewalk to provide a smooth transition.

properties.barrier: The Emergency phone case latch is located so the handle is not accessible.
properties.solution: Remove the sides of the phone case or relocate the Emergency phone so that the handle being interfered with by the sides of the case.

properties.barrier: The entrance walkway to the doors to the south Treetop Caf  there is a 4.8% running slope.
properties.solution: Remove and regrade section to provide an accessible route with a running slope no greater than 5% and a cross slope no greater than 2%.

properties.barrier: The entrance walkway to the doors to the south Treetop Caf  there is a 4.8% running slope.
properties.solution: Provide a minimum 5 foot level landing of no more than 2% in all directions at the door.  Or provide an automatic door that complies with ADAAG 404.3.

properties.barrier: The Tree Top Caf exit doors do not provide a level landing and has a running slope too high at 19.1%.
properties.solution: If possible, remove and regrade section to provide a running slope no greater than 5% and a cross slope no greater than 2%. Because of the slope in this area regrading to 5% may not be possible. Follow ADAAG 405 for ramps if necessary.

properties.barrier: The Tree Top Caf exit doors do not provide a level landing and has a running slope too high at 19.1%.
properties.solution: Provide a minimum 5 foot level landing of no more than 2% in all directions at the door.  Or provide an automatic door that complies with ADAAG 404.3.

properties.barrier: The Tree Top Caf outdoor seating paver surface have gaps and abrupt transitions throughout.
properties.solution: Re-set the brick pavers to provide a smooth transition between pavers and gaps no wider than 1/2 inch.

properties.barrier: The walkway from back exit of the outdoor seating to the playground has an abrupt transition too high at 3/4 inch where surfaces meet.
properties.solution: Grind down or replace section of sidewalk to provide a smooth transition.

properties.barrier: The wood inserted between pavers along walkway of plaza have deteriorated or shifted to create gaps too wide and abrupt transitions too high.
properties.solution: Re-set the brick pavers and/or replace the wood inserts to provide a smooth transition between pavers and gaps no wider than 1/2 inch.

properties.barrier: The door to the restrooms area has round hardware.
properties.solution: Replace door hardware with hardware that does not require tight grasping, tight pinching or twisting of the wrist, such as lever hardware.

properties.barrier: The women's restroom door has round hardware.
properties.solution: Replace door hardware with hardware that does not require tight grasping, tight pinching or twisting of the wrist, such as lever hardware.

properties.barrier: The men's restroom door has round hardware.
properties.solution: Replace door hardware with hardware that does not require tight grasping, tight pinching or twisting of the wrist, such as lever hardware.

properties.barrier: The door opening force is too high at 22 lbs. for the first emergency door and 29 lbs. for the second emergency door.
properties.solution: Recommendation: While not specifically address by the ADA it would be recommended to adjust the closer so the door opening force is no heavier than 8.5 lbs. to open and takes a minimum of 5 seconds to close or provide an automatic door opener at the door.

properties.barrier: With all the plantings and dirt walkway there is no accessible route to these emergency exit doors.
properties.solution: Clear the plantings to provide an accessible route with a running slope no steeper than 5% and a cross slope no steeper than 2% and a minimum clear width of 36 inches.

properties.barrier: Several plants along the walkway have branches that protrude below 80 inches.
properties.solution: Trim or tie back the branches to provide an 80 inches minimum clear head space and back to the edge of the walkway.

properties.barrier: The door opening force of the third emergency door is too high at 21 lbs. and closes too quickly at 4 seconds.
properties.solution: Recommendation: While not specifically address by the ADA it would be recommended to adjust the closer so the door opening force is no heavier than 8.5 lbs. to open and takes a minimum of 5 seconds to close or provide an automatic door opener at the door.

properties.barrier: With all the plantings and dirt there is no accessible route to this emergency exit door.
properties.solution: Provide a new accessible route with a running slope no steeper than 5% and a cross slope no steeper than 2% and a minimum clear width of 36 inches.

properties.barrier: The elevator does not provide an accessible handle on the emergency phone.
properties.solution: Provide a handle on the elevator control panel door that does not require tight grasping, pinching or twisting of the wrist.

properties.barrier: The area under the stairs does not provide a cane delectable barrier.
properties.solution: Provide a cane detectable barrier at the base of the stairway when the vertical clearance is below 80 inches AFF.

properties.locationb: First Floor Exhibits from Tropical Forest

properties.solution: Adjust the closer so the door opening force is no heavier than 5 lbs. to open and takes a minimum of 5 seconds to close or provide an automatic door opener at the door.

properties.solution: Adjust the closer so the door opening force is no heavier than 5 lbs. to open and takes a minimum of 5 seconds to close or provide an automatic door opener at the door.

properties.solution: The handrails shall have a diameter of 1 1/4 inches to 2 inches for a circular handrail and for non-circular shall have a diameter of 2 1/4 inches and a perimeter dimension of 4 inches minimum to 6 1/4 inches maximum.

properties.barrier: There are some plants that protrudes into the ramp.

properties.locationb: Path Along African Animals Heading West Toward Giraffes

properties.solution: Bench Recommendation: Provide at least 20% but no less than two benches to provide a clear ground space of at least 30" by 48" positioned near the bench with one side adjoining the walkway. The clear ground space should have a slope no steeper than 2% in all directions. The clear ground space should not overlap the accessible route or another clear ground space. UD -  Provide benches with armrests, backs, seat height between 17" AFF to 19" AFF maximum and no gaps between the seat and backrest.

properties.barrier: The Lion restroom accessible stall door is not self closing.
properties.solution: Provide the hinges to allow for the stall door to be self-closing.

properties.barrier: The Lion restroom toilet paper dispenser is not in proper location to toilet seat.
properties.solution: Remount the toilet paper dispenser to be no lower than 15", no higher than 48" AFF and a centerline of the dispenser that is a minimum of 7" to a maximum of 9" in front of the toilet. Do no mount the toilet paper dispenser behind the side grab bar.

properties.solution: Recommendation: While not specifically address by the ADA it would be recommended to adjust the closer so the door opening force is no heavier than 8.5 lbs. to open and takes a minimum of 5 seconds to close or provide an automatic door opener at the door.

properties.solution: Provide an accessible stall that is a minimum of 60" wide and a minimum of 56" deep with a minimum 42" side grab bar mounted 12" maximum from the corner and a 36" rear grab bar mounted 12" minimum from the centerline and 24" from the centerline to the transfer side of the toilet. The toilet centerline should be 16" to 18" from the nearest wall and a minimum 17" to a maximum 19" to the top of the seat. This will require removal of the adjacent toilet and taking over that space. Check plumbing codes to determine if this is acceptable related to the fixture count.

properties.solution: Provide a rear grab bar a minimum of 36" long mounted 12" from the centerline of the toilet to the corner and 24" from the centerline to the open side of the toilet.
